meanings.definition: Divide (a region or group) into smaller and hostile states or groups.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was balkanising the students into two teams for the debate.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's actions were balkanising the once united country.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were balkanising the household chores, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The virus was balkanising the cells, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was balkanising the land, creating new boundaries.

meanings.definition: To create divisions or factions within a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The gossip was balkanising the office workers, leading to conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The political scandal was balkanising the party members.
meanings.sent3: The prank was balkanising the friends, but they all laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The misunderstanding was balkanising the team, affecting their performance.
meanings.sent5: The new policy was balkanising the employees, causing unrest.
